sentence.Network_en: The barrel of gunpowder blew up with a terrible noise.
sentence.Network_cn: 火药桶爆炸了,发出轰然一声巨响.

sentence.Network_en: Gunpowder was used in China as far back as the 11 th century.
sentence.Network_cn: 远在公元11世纪,中国已使用火药.

sentence.Network_en: This statement has a strong smell of gunpowder.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是一篇充满火药味的声明.

entry.def: Gunpowder is an explosive substance which is used to make fireworks or cause explosions.

means.word_mean: 1. a mixture of potassium nitrate, charcoal, and sulfur in a 75:15:10 ratio which is used in gunnery, time fuses, and fireworks

auth_sentence.content: The Chinese did not have science just because they discovered gunpowder.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Chinese did not have science just because they discovered gunpowder.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Chinese did not have science just because they discovered gunpowder.

auth_sentence.content: The substance that puts the oomph into most fireworks is gunpowder.
auth_sentence.res_content: The substance that puts the oomph into most fireworks is gunpowder.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The substance that puts the oomph into most fireworks is gunpowder.

sentences.en: Gunpowder was introduced into Europe during the first half of the 14th century.
sentences.cn: 在14世纪上半叶,火药传入欧洲。

sentences.en: The barrel of gunpowder blew up with a terrible noise.
sentences.cn: 火药桶爆炸了,发出轰然一声巨响。
